Description: Toshiba Corporation reached a settlement with the United States as part of a class action suit in connection with the company's sale of defective laptop computers to government agencies. The settlement also released Toshiba from liability under the False Claims Act for the sale of defective laptop computers. In addition to paying the United States $23 million, Toshiba agreed to provide the government with $10.5 million in coupons from the company for the purchase of Toshiba products.

Description: Bechtel/Parsons Brinkerhoff, Bechtel Infrastructure Corp, PB Americas and 24 section design consultants agreed to pay a total of $447 million in settlement of criminal and civil liablities in the collapse of part of the I-90 tunnel and defects in the wall of the Tip O'Neill tunnel. Bechtel was to pay $357.1 million and Parsons $50 million. The announcement did not indicate how the remaining $40 million payment would be divided among the consultants. Here we assume each paid an equal amount.

The Washington Attorney General announced that Toshiba agreed to pay $1.3 million as part of the AG's price-fixing lawsuit against seven manufacturers of cathode ray tubes, or CRTs, from 1995 to 2007.

Attorney General Bob Ferguson announced settlements totaling $44 million from seven liquid crystal display (LCD) manufacturers accused of engaging in a price-fixing conspiracy that drove up prices consumers paid on items like TVs, laptops and cell phones.
Toshiba, LG Display and AU Optronics agreed to pay a total of $571 million to settle multistate litigation accusing them of engaging in price fixing of flat-screen LCD panels.

The California Attorney General announced settlements resolving allegations that LG, Hitachi, Panasonic, Toshiba, and Samsung, companies all based in Japan or Korea, fixed prices on cathode ray tubes from 1995 to 2007.
Toshiba Corporation and three of its subsidiaries agreed to pay more than $30 million to California public agencies in settlement of a lawsuit alleging violation of the state False Claims Act.
